Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2011 04:01PM FaithFollower wrote: Hi Ladies - Just jumping in from Dec rads... ONE MORE TO GO -- woohoo!!  I'm lubed up, peely, itchy and saggy but thrilled to almost be over this hurdle.  My magic lube potion was - aloe vera gel (GNC sells purse sized tubes), hydrocortisone cream, topped w/zinc oxide - the tech recommended this combo when  Aquaphor and Xclair didn't help when I had the severe burn last week (RO said it happens only 15% of the time)  I'm rather large breasted (34H) and can't wear a bra - fun times at work!  I wear cotton v-neck cami's w/spaghetti straps, one boob in/one out so they don't fight or rub, topped w/a cotton long sleeved shirt - the tightness around the arm & pit keep my skin from rubbing.  I wear everything inside-out so the seams don't rub my skin.  Old Navy has the tank's/cami's and I got the long sleeve shirts @ Target.  To disguise the sagging nipples, I got a poncho/wrap thing @ Kohl's, pin it shut and walk very intentionally or hold something at chest level! I'll stick around to see if I can offer any support to y'all. Hang in there - you can do it!
Posts.Title: January 2011 Rads suzieq60 msjag

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2011 12:02PM FaithFollower wrote: CMF- my lumpectomy was at 1p as well as rads but no trouble breathing.  SE of chemo was tight chest feeling stuff, but not during rads.  Teklya - I'm soo jealous - I want my port out soo badly! When I go to rads I take my reusable lunch bag filled w/all my goo, complete with the moist wipes I used when I had h'roids from chemo.  The cream wipes off great w/those things and they are so fresh smelling too! ;-D  Off to my last rad !!! TTL, Goo-bie aka Wendy

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2011 10:41PM FaithFollower wrote: Hi ladies - I'm a lurker!  I've read everyone's posts re hesitancy to go topless but I've been "nude" since just before round 6 of chemo - total bullet head!  My microfilament wig got too big and I felt like I needed to adjust all the time.  Didn't want to invest in more fake hair for the duration so I wore hats.  Got sick of the chemo hat look and went nude one day to work and everyone gave me thumbs up!  Gave me the courage to continue.  I have so many cowlicks I can't believe it! can't figure out how to insert a picture! oh well, just take my word for it -- naturally curly hair, boxed brown!   http://picasaweb.google.com/lh/photo/aLX6CRV6n7-Ex4t0HWOTSjBr5MREBrm-tzd_G6aiEGY?feat=directlink

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2010 04:22PM FaithFollower wrote: Cindy, thanks for the updates.  Keep em coming!  I am workin thru chemo as best I can.  I had round 2 yesterday afternoon and am working a full day today (thanks to the steroids!).  The first round I worked partial days mon & tues due to fatigue but then back to full days on Wed's.  I selected a doctor 10 min away from work to get radiation after chemo is through so I can keep workin - I never thought I'd be so glad to go to work everyday, but it helps me tremendously.  I heard aquaphor and aloe vera is the best for the redness/skin irration for BC radiation. Take care! Wendy
Posts.Title: recently diagnosed surgery completed CindyRN LizM

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2011 03:38PM FaithFollower wrote: Hi Ladies - starting to get plugged in on different forums now that I'M DONE W/RADIATION TODAY!! woohoo!  Can u tell i'm excited?  I see my onc Friday to do blood work/determine anti-hormonal treatment and get referrals for my follow up mammo & mri.  My CT scan for my sim showed an enlarged heart so I'm concerned about SE's of AI's and such.  Haven't had a period since July and have been getting hot flashes since - at least my migraines are gone!  When did you ladies start coloring your hair (if you lost it during chemo)?
Posts.Title: CALLING ALL STAGE I SISTERS sheila888 MCBaker

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2011 06:50PM FaithFollower wrote: Jo - sorry to hear about your MS progression. Shelia - I'm praying for your Aunt and God's discernment for your decision to travel.  Personally, I'd try to do both simply because I can't live w/o seeing my daughter for more than 6-8 mos. and feeling pulled to see your Aunt will only cause you stress (which you don't need). Ladies, thank you for the reassurances re joint/muscle pain. I feel like I'm 90+.  I asked my onc for a bone density to help make decision re anti-hormone treatment.  I asked my radiation doc for echo cuz my ct scan for rads showed an enlarged heart.  Results from both tests will help determine best Rx for man pills (I like that one but I'm already the husband in my house! bahahaha) Sorry, I digress.  HMO approved echo but asked for more info supporting bone density scan.  We'll see what the final determination is but I'll get it done anyway cuz I have 2 ins. co's and the other will pay - I'm VERY lucky, I know!.
Posts.Title: CALLING ALL STAGE I SISTERS sheila888 MCBaker

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2011 07:56PM FaithFollower wrote: Hi MDG - yes I got chemo and have 1 more rad left (30 total).  Due to my age, 43, and the recurrence rate of 3%, I elected to cure my cancer w/6 rounds of chemo (TC), radiation & anti-hormonal drugs (tbd).  I looked at chemo as a really bad cleanse with an opportunity to see what my natural hair color really is!  Praying for wisdom and peace in your decision.

She relentlessly insistents I find a compression garment in the shape of a tube top - just pick something up at Victoria Secret...I'm a 32-H pre-LE! So frustrating. Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2011 05:05PM FaithFollower wrote: Hi Ladies - finished chemo 10/10 and rads 1/11. I now have neuropathy in my hands when I only had it bit in my feet during chemo! My joints are still achy and now my good knee popped out on me so I'm rehabing it. My hairs are growing but my nails aren't as strong as when I was on chemo (go figure). Haven't started AH meds yet -- will discuss w/doc next month. Getting my echo results monday as my rad ct scan showed an enlarged heart - hope its nothing. Had a brief anxiety attack going to cardiologist's office as it was next door to the hospital where I had my lumpectomy. I was surprised at my reaction but acknowledged it and moved on. Can't seem to get rid of the tire that's planted itself above my underwear band, not like there wasn't something there to begin w/but it wasn't as "full." Wonder if I'm retaining water?? Was hoping for a miraculous, bounce back, post-treatment body but have been sorely disappointed.  No offense meant to Dem's, but my body has the Obama-redistribution plan goin on! Totally sux
